alert.note: Alert for Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 5:34PM MST until February 26 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Northwestern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Southwestern Ector County in western Texas... Northwestern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Ward County in western Texas... Winkler County in western Texas... Southwestern Crane County in western Texas... Presidio County in southwestern Texas... Central Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Loving County in western Texas... * Until 830 PM CST/730 PM MST/. * At 634 PM CST/534 PM MST/, a dust channel was 24 miles north of Marathon, or 27 miles northeast of Alpine, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 273. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 88. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Fort Stockton, Monahans, Alpine, Kermit, Van Horn, Jal, Marfa, Wink, Kent, Toyah, Fort Davis, Candelaria, Mentone, Balmorhea, Thorntonville, Barstow, Valentine, Pyote and Jal Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
